fields.name: Discrete Structures for Computer Science
fields.description: Covers the basic mathematical tools essential for solving problems in computer science.

fields.name: Introduction to Programming
fields.description: An introduction to programming with a focus on problem solving, structured programming, and algorithm design.

fields.name: Data Structuers 1
fields.description: A first course on data structures in Java for graduate students. The course introduces Java programming.

fields.name: Data Structuers 2
fields.description: This is the second course on data structures in Java for graduate students.

fields.name: Systems 1
fields.description: An introductory graduate course on computer systems topics.

fields.name: Systems 2
fields.description: Second course on computer systems topics.

fields.name: Applied Algorithms and Structures
fields.description: This course covers techniques for designing and analyzing algorithms and structures.

fields.name: Distributed Systems I
fields.description: An introduction to distributed systems.

fields.name: Concepts of Programming Languages
fields.description: Programming paradigms and language concepts: functional programming.

fields.name: Database Technologies
fields.description: A core graduate course in database design and implementation.

fields.name: Object-Oriented Software Development
fields.description: Principle, techniques and tools of object-oriented modeling, design, implementation, and testing.

fields.name: Object Oriented Modeling
fields.description: Object-oriented modeling techniques for analysis and design.

fields.name: Object-Oriented Enterprise Computing
fields.description: Applying object-oriented techniques in the design, development, and integration of server-side enterprise applications.

fields.name: Architecture and Frameworks for Developing Client Applications
fields.description: Focus on software for developing web-based thin client applications.

fields.name: Service-Oriented Architecture
fields.description: Study of service oriented architecture (SOA) from the business, architectural, and technology perspectives.

fields.name: Software Validation and Verification
fields.description: Techniques, methods and tools for software inspection and testing.

fields.name: Software Engineering Studio
fields.description: Students will work in small teams to develop realistic software systems in a master-apprentice environment.

fields.name: Software Engineering Studio II
fields.description: This is the continuation of SE 491.

fields.name: Optimized C++
fields.description: Focus on developing software to efficiently use the fixed CPU power and resources.

fields.name: Physics for Game Developers
fields.description: The course concentrates on Newton's Laws of Motion, kinematics and kinetics.

fields.name: Game Engine Programming I
fields.description: This course designs and implements a custom real-time game engine.

fields.name: Game Development Studio I
fields.description: Students will work in small teams to design and implement a computer game.

fields.name: Game Development Studio II
fields.description: Continuation of GAM 690

fields.name: Computer Graphics Development
fields.description: Basic graphics architecture. Coordinate systems. Three-dimensional representations and transformations.

fields.name: Hardware Shading Techniques
fields.description: This class explores the current trends in programmable computer graphics hardware.

fields.name: Systems Analysis
fields.description: Course focus is on both traditional and object oriented systems analysis, with an emphasis upon developing competency in a wide range of modeling techniques.

fields.name: Database Design
fields.description: Requirement analysis, conceptual design, logical design and implementation of relational databases.

fields.name: System Design, Implementation and Maintenance
fields.description: Course focus is on both traditional and object oriented systems design.

fields.name: Fundamentals of IT Project Management
fields.description: This course concentrates on monitoring, managing and controlling assets and resources on a single IT project.

fields.name: Information Security Management
fields.description: Survey of information security management as it applies to information systems analysis, design, and operations.

fields.name: Organizational Modeling
fields.description: The course explores contemporary approaches to analyzing and modeling organizational problems, processes, workflow, users and data.

fields.name: Requirements Elicitation, Analysis and Specification
fields.description: Course focus is on both traditional and object oriented systems analysis, with an emphasis upon developing competency in a wide range of modeling techniques.

fields.name: Information Technology Investment Financial Analysis
fields.description: This course focuses on the application of financial analysis and decision-making approaches to aid information technology investment decisions at the operational, project, tactical and strategic levels.
fields.prereq: SE477 or IS565 or ACCT500 or IS430 or PM430 or ECT455

fields.name: Enterprise Systems
fields.description: An introduction to enterprise systems for data and process integration, including ERP systems.

fields.name: Enterprise Infrastructure
fields.description: Introduction to modern infrastructure and the evolving technology environment.

fields.name: Intranets and Portals
fields.description: Intranet development methodology. Data warehousing concept and On-Line analytic processing (OLAP) for information management. Enterprise information portals (EIP).

fields.name: Introduction to User-Centered Design
fields.description: The user-interface development process. Introduction to methods for practicing user-centered design including user and task analysis, user interface design principles and testing using low-fidelity prototypes.

fields.name: Digital Product Management
fields.description: This course focuses on the central role of the Product Manager in creating and sustaining compelling products and services throughout the product lifecycle.

fields.name: Collaborative Technologies for Leading Projects
fields.description: Study of the process of virtual teaming with emphasis on facilitation of different time project activities and facilitation of same time meetings.

fields.name: Electronic Business
fields.description: An introduction to electronic business. The topics include business models, technologies, business and social impact of e-business.

fields.name: Global Information Technology
fields.description: A study of the hardware, software, and techniques for using virtual information technologies to support teams working in a distributed, virtual, or global enviornments.

fields.name: Enterprise Project Management
fields.description: This course covers how an enterprise coordinates and effectively manages all its IT projects and programs through program management and the IT program management office.

fields.name: IT Outsourcing
fields.description: The course focuses on how organizations can use leverage of scale as a source for cost reduction; leverage of expertise for improved superior IT performance; leverage of access (e.g. location) to develop new strategies.

fields.name: Information Technology Consulting
fields.description: This course is for the IT professional. The emphasis is on examining the models, techniques, and skill development for providing effective IT consulting services.

fields.name: Software-Intensive Systems Engineering and Management
fields.description: This course will introduce students to fundamental principles of systems engineering for large and complex software intensive systems.
fields.prereq: ( SE477 or PM430 or IS430 ) and ( SE430 or SE482 or IS485 )

fields.name: CAPSTONE: Information Systems Policies and Strategies
fields.description: This capstone course emphasizes the planning and management of information technologies and related resources at the corporate level.

fields.name: Scripting for Interactive Systems
fields.description: Introductory scripting for developing interactive web pages. Overview of HTML and CSS.

fields.name: Data Warehousing
fields.description: Introduction to data warehousing and the foundations of understanding the issues involved in building a successful data warehouse.

fields.name: Database Administration and Management
fields.description: This course is designed to give students a comprehensive foundation in database administration and management.

fields.name: Database Programming
fields.description: Programming in a large-scale relational database environment using procedural languages.
fields.prereq: ( CSC453 or CSC451 or CSC455 ) and ( CSC401 or IT411 )

fields.name: Advanced Database Management
fields.description: In this class, we will discuss concepts, technologies, guiding principles, processes and best practices in managing database environment to meet high availability, scalability, and compliance needs.

fields.name: Big Data and NoSQL Program
fields.description: A 11-week certificate program covering popular NoSQL databases and how they fit with Big Data.

fields.name: Big Data and the Internet of Things (Iot)
fields.description: This course surveys system design concepts, techniques, and algorithms in Machine to Machine (M2M), Internet of Things (IoT), and Internet of Everything (IoE).

fields.name: Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery Theories and Strategies
fields.description: This course focuses on the knowledge necessary for an organization to prepare for a variety of major disruptions (floods, earthquakes, terrorist attacks, etc.).

fields.name: Enterprise Cloud Computing
fields.description: Cloud concepts, architecture, and service management, with particular emphasis upon identifying and analyzing potential business applications of cloud computing.

fields.name: Enterprise Data Management
fields.description: This course focuses on the technical concepts and managerial knowledge needed to define, integrate and govern centralized and distributed data for a wide range of application systems used at large, multinational corporations.
